page.title: 19PUDSEY SHOW
page.content: Pudsey Show takes place every year on the second Saturday in July at Grange Park.The first was held in 1949 to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Pudsey being granted a charter.People show their animals and can enter in the handicraft,horticulture,baking or flower-arranging sections.Other attractions usually include a fair- ground,refreshments,shire horses,pony rides and trade stands.This year's entertainment was provided by the West Yorkshire Metropolitan Police Pipe Band and the 68th Durham Light Infantry who enacted a battle. Most work is done voluntarily to keep down the cost of admission - Â£1 for adults and 50p for children.Most of the profit goes to local charities who help out at the show.The show is proof that the people of Pudsey want to keep its traditions alive.
